I was placed on hold for approx. 5 minutes when I called to find out where the pizza was prior to arrival, they hung up the phone on me before I could inquire and had to call back....placed on hold again for approx two and half minutes. Finally I spoke to "Frank", he explained to me that they were busy and seemed very stressed out over the phone, I got a very insincere apology. The delivery person gave me a smirk and came across very cocky and not caring about his tardiness. The pizza arrived luke warm at best. When I called back to speak to "Frank", I was placed on hold again this time for approx. 9 minutes. I expressed my concerns.......he explained again how busy they were today and finally offered to re-make the pizza only after I asked for the store# (753) and the manager's name (Mr. Kamau Jones), I declined because on how the delivery person's attitude was. I don't want to eat a possibly contaminated pizza. Horrible service and I will continue to complain to a higher authority if need be. I paid $30.00 plus a $5 tip for a cold pizza and bad attitude's from your employees!
author: Jorge R.

description: Love this place!  The service is great and the people are very helpful, accommodating, and friendly.  We've used this location for many, many years and they have never let us down.
author: Susie W.

description: Ordered a pizza for delivery. They told me it would take 45 minutes to an hour. Sounds reasonable right? An hour an 20 minutes passed by until we decided to call them. They told us 45 more minutes. They clearly forgot to make our pizza. Never ordering there again. This has never happened to me anywhere else.
author: Kazz E.

description: Met up with my hubby here for lunch. This Round Table beats others. We ordered the lunch specials and the pizza was great with the perfect amount of ingredients and friendly employees. All in all a nice laid back joint with hot and cheesy pizza for the foggy peaks.
author: Trish B.

description: I have been ordering from RT at this and their other recently closed West Portal location since President Nixon was in the White House.  Their pizzas are made from very fresh ingredients and their sauce is the best!  I like mine cooked a particular way and they always make it the way I ask, even on busy nights.  The delivery guys are pleasant and the food gets to me hot.  You can count on getting a well prepared and hearty meal at a fair price.
author: Storm J.

description:
If you like to eat clean food, stay away from this location. The employees are not sanitary and they do not wear gloves. The employees hands and nails are dirty (looks black), filled with all types of chemicals used to clean up their area. Don't be surprised if you get food sickness. If you complain to the owner Jeffrey, he will tell you not to come back to this location. Stay away from this location if you don't want to get food poisoning and terrible customer service.

Jeffrey is the owner of this location and Pops sandwich next door. He trains his employees to have crappy customer service just like Pops sandwich. So it's understandable that it has bad reviews. Don't bother complaining cause they will give you a rude attitude and do something to your food. Avoid this place and Pops sandwich at all cost. Check my other reviews to see what they did to the sandwich I ordered and read what happened when I complained.
author: unknown u.

description:
After not using them for a few months, I decided to give them another try. They immediately put you on-hold (seems standard even if they are totally not-busy), then make you sit on-hold for 5 minutes. I hang-up, try again, same guy, same standard 'please hold' then wait 5 minutes. Hear guys bs'ing in the background before click to hold again. Wait 5 minutes, happens again. Told guy I have been waiting, he apologizes then puts me on-hold again. Call back one last time and before the same guy can dump me on-hold again, I tell him I am calling someone else to get pizza since they don't want the business. 

I encourage you to give them a try if you have low self-esteem and time to waste. If you are like me and many others who just want pizza delivered, try Extreme PIzza or Mozzerall Di Bufalo in West Portola. 

These guys are a joke.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Decent.

Good pizza. 

Tiny place. But, they had the soccer game on, so that was nice. 

The salad bar looked edible.
author: Misha F.

description: After posting my awful experience at this location and also emailing headquarters.  I have to say I was contacted by the manager who apologized about the bad service and made good by a gift certificate and letting me know that the little prick who worked there is gone.  I ordered pizza a second time and receiving good service and prompt delivery.  Thank you for making it right RT.
author: Ray A.

description:
Are you the one delivering my pizzas?  cause the one at portola in store is awesome.

This is the one that delivers to my inner sunset home?

Cause if you are..... oh my gosh you suck.

Round Table is my favourite pizza ever, and you can judge me.  But as a lover of it, this one sucks.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
As far as pizza goes, Round Table is consistent from location to location. Service on the other hand can vary significantly. Tried to place a phone order for pick up at this particular location and was placed on hold so many times that I eventually gave up. 

Recommendation, order at the West Portal location. The staff there is nicer, a whole lot cleaner and they seem to actually want your business.
author: Rick C.

description:
I've had spotty service from this location, but this one took the cake. I ordered a small Garlic Supreme from them the other night and was told 1 hr. to 1:15. Fair enough - they're busy.

1:30 - Call again to ask for an update. "The driver just walked out the door. It'll be a couple of minutes, sorry we were slammed tonight."

2:10 - Call again and tell them, "You know what? Just cancel my order. I'm hungry now and am going to forage in the fridge." 

them - "But the driver just left a second ago and is headed there right now!"

me - "I don't care, you should have called and let me know if it was going to be this late. Not to mention you told me 30 min ago that the driver was just leaving then. What's up with that?"

them - "I didn't tell you that, it was someone else."

me - "I don't care *who* told me that, it has been well over 2 hours now and no pizza and I'm hungry. Just cancel it."

them - "It's free! It's free! Just tell the driver that it's free. It'll be there in a minute."

me - "whatever. Look this is really horrible service. You need to look into that. Although I doubt I'll be ordering here again."

2:35 - pizza arrives (After I warmed up some delicious dandelion green and goat cheese pasta with garlic bread I made the night before.

Driver - "that will be $12.40"

Me - "You manager said it's free"

Driver - "OK. here you go"

Not at all surprised? Hmmm... could this be a common occurrence there? Yeah, that's it the last pie they'll ever make for me.
author: Peter T.

description:
I have eaten at the location as well as had it delivered. It is usually hit or miss. The smaller pizza's are almost always good, but the larger you go the gooier it seems to be. 

Ordered once and waited over 1 hour and 20 minutes (when food arrived it was cooked and then mushrooms were thrown on) told us they forgot to add mushrooms so went back to store to put them on? Weird but the management gave us our pizza free.
author: mary f.

description: I needed a quick bite before we were heading up to PDX on tour and stopped in as they were closing. Honestly, I had the best service I had ever experienced from a chain-pizzeria. This Round Table is great: Chris. You rule!!!
author: Kevin G.

description:
I think I'm sticking with the Round Table at West Portal.  First off that one at least sorta feels like a restaurant so you can sit and eat without feeling too out of place.  This one was obviously thrown together just for carryout pizza, the 3 booths were so dirty and covered with stuff and the 3 little tables they had were no better.  Also the walls were plain and looked like no one even cared enough to hang up a single picture on the wall.  

So let's say this is strictly for take out.  Well the pizza still wasn't that great.  First off it was burnt.  It was more blackish than any other color.  The toppings were just thrown on there, not even distributed at all evenly, one half had more sausage than anything else and the bacon somehow just clumped in one corner.  ( we had one of the ulti meat pizzas).  So nevertheless that was a huge let down.  

The buffalo wings were good and so were the Parmesan twists.  But as good as they were, when you are a pizza joint, I would hope that you would master the pizza, the very thing you are supposed to be known for.  

If I were to come back here, I'd get the wings and twists and skip the pizza.  Or I would go to the one at West Portal and get the pizza, wings and twists there.  

The staff was nice though, I will say that.  Now if they could clean their tables off after customers leave, and maybe hang up some pictures on the bare walls, and work on not burning their pizza, we'd be set.
author: Denise B.

description: Today the girl collected my cash.  Then she helped another customer who paid with cash.  THEN she proceeded to make pizza while using the same gloves she used to collect the money.  I guess the oven kills off the money germs.  Just don't go for one of her freshly made salads.
author: Joe N.

description:
Its a west coast chain......a simple pizza.  I found the crust to taste a bit like something ud find at a carnival....you know with the small holes in the crust so it wont rise??

We got the King Arthur.  The ingredients were tasty and the pizza was juicy which is important to me.  One major flaw was the over saltiness.    You really need to suck down a sweet soda with their pizza.

Id like to try another RT pizza with just mushrooms and see how the saltiness fairs.

Overall, I would go back only if my partner REALLY wants to go.
author: culinary q.

description: I'm a sucker for Round Table pizza.  Nothing fancy but consistently good.  And they deliver on a schedule, which is really great.
author: Anne C.

description: I've changed my review from 4-stars to 1-star because I am sorry to say that, after years and years and years of being on West Portal, this location has closed down.  Apparently there were some conflicts between the owner and the manager or something along those lines.  Whatever the reason is, we're sorry it's no longer in the neighborhood,
author: Jessica G.

description: 30mins late. I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and what I got was marinara sauge,chicken,red onion with BBQ sauce drizzled on top. Wtf..
author: Claudia S.

description: I must agree with other yelpers, This is probably by far one of the worst round table I've been to. Honestly, it deserve 2 start because I'm in love with the garlic twist, and.. it's close by where I love.
author: Lianne D.

description: When you charge $20+ for a pizza, you should be able to afford more competent help than disgruntled, stoned teenagers.  (Not that I have anything against disgruntled, stoned teenagers.  I just don't trust their customer service or...uh...sanitation skills anymore than I do my OWN from back when I was a disgruntled, stoned teenager.)  And heaven forbid you have more than one person working at a time so that pizzas can get made and tables can get cleaned at the SAME TIME.  These are shocking suggestions, I know...
author: Kevin H.

description: I would normally give Round Table 4 stars based on the usual quality and service I'd minimally expect.  This one however, gets three.  I don't enjoy seeing the same kid who made my pizza 5 minutes before, smoking a joint in the parking lot.  Call the manager and say "so and so was out in the parking lot getting high" and get a disinterested response.  It's not cool.  Homey don't play that game.
author: Katie H.

description: I use to work on west portal and the only reason i went to this place was because it was affordable and one of the few non waiter restaurants on the street. The employees that worked here were horrible. Multiple times they forgot about my order. Most of the people that work/worked (changes frequently) here are mid 20s burn outs who think they should be working somewhere better even though this is actually where they deserve to work. I usually got the lunch sandwich deal and it was a good sandwich at a good price but it was not enjoyable to eat here. It is also very small inside so I would recommend getting take out from this place if you really want some round table food and this is the closest one to you.
author: Matthew G.

description: It's OK, but I wasn't to happy with the pizza I got. The taste, the tempreture, the price. Everything wasn't right that day. Maybe I just had a so-so day.
author: Alla S.

description: In beauty school I learned about two things...good food and how to do a finger wave.   I went to beauty school in San Bruno and most of the girls were bay area natives unlike me the BA transplant.  So I'm used to buzz worthy SF places like the ones on yelp(Country Station and Weird Fish).  But the girls in beauty school knew of all the local divey places and the good chain places like Round Table.  It's refreshing since SF peeps easily turn their noses up at perfectly good food for no reason other than it's not cool.   I don't really love pizza I'm more a rice and noodle kind of girl.  But every once in a while I crave the gooey stuff and particularly from Round Table.  I never crave any other kind of pizza.    Anyway I have ordered delivery twice and it's been really good every time.  I love their sauce and the crust is the best unlike it's oily nemesis the pizza hut crust. Yummy!
author: Joni S.

description: I like eating here, and they have a salad bar, but theyre so rude on the tele!!!
author: kim w.

description: This place was cool. I liked going here in 2000 when I finished watching a movie down the street.  Nice, Clean, okay prices, and delicious.
author: Keit K.

description:
I like Round Tables better than most pizza places. There are some independents that obviously make better pizzas, and those are the ones that are a little more pricey. For price and quality, I think Round Table is good news.

That being said, this Round Table isn't as good as others. There do seem to be a little more toppings, which is good, but less crust and less cheese, which is not good. 

If it was like NY style thin crust, I wouldn't complain. But in this situation it tastes and seems like they are going that route to save money. Too bad it affects quality.

They do some great deals with coupons, though. Quality isn't as important in those instances, so if you are getting a deal, go for it! Otherwise, it is just an ok pizza.
author: Katie C.

description: I usually order delivery from here and have never had any problems. My order always shows up hot, yummy, and on time. However tonight I went in to pick up my order myself and was pleasantly surprised. The guy behind the counter was so polite! Something you don't see in people these days. My pizza can out right on time and with a smile. My food was extra yummy tonight because of the great staff!
author: Karen A.

description: I used to come here in middle school for pizza and I still come here when I'm around the block. I love Round Table Pizza and this spot makes the pizza in a timely manner and are pretty friendly. The place is kind of small in the front, but in the back there is seating for a nice small party.
author: Edgar G.

description: I've had this twice now.  We didnt have round table pizza in new england, but i liked this right away.  I've had the pineapple and the vegetarian, which has lots of really good veggies and is so tasty!  I've only had the soft crust, but its really good.  This has been takeout at my friend's house, so i havent seen the actual building. the pizza comes on time and is not greasy at all.
author: Merredith L.

description: Good pizza, but I would recommend picking-up or eating-in. We placed an order at work today for delivery and had to wait about an hour for our pizza!! It was also kinda cold by the time it arrived. But, other than that, good pizza, especially when I get a pizza craving. Mmm!
author: Audrey T.

description: Mmm...Round Table...all of them...the chain, it's the best of the best (of all the industrial, frozen dough, coupon-offering) chain pizzas you'll ever have.
author: G J J.

description: I went here last Saturday night and the place was absolutely disgusting! We had to wipe crumbs off of the seats before sitting, the floor was littered with dirty napkins, pizza crust and used plates.  The tables weren't wiped down, the bathroom was awful.  I could maybe understand if it had been really crowded but there were only 3 people in the place the entire time we were there.
author: Johanna W.

description: Decent. Typical chain pizza place. It's definately nothing special. The pizza comes out better though when you know a employee!
author: Katherine C.

description: The pizza could have tasted better considering I had better pizza at other local Round Tables...Plus the employees look like they never wash their aprons and look dirty and untidy! Very small dinning area and shakers are greasy and nasty to even use seems like no one ever wipes them off with sanitizer or anything this place is nasty!
author: Michael H.

description:
the pizza is the regular round table pizza here, which isn't that great to begin with.

but i am completely disappointed in the garlic twists here. The only reason i subject my arteries to this stuff is for the garlic twists, and i dont know what it is about the ones they make here, but they are discus ting. Damn you this round table for ruining my garlic twists!
author: Casey Z.

description: VERY generic pizza. Taste and looks like it came from a gas station. Not horrible just very forgettable. wings are baked and have no sauce, garlic bread was very good though. Overall i probably would not order again but the price and service was better then most.
author: Laura M.

description: the pizza here is delicious! Yummy! The crust is unforgettable! I always crave it. Be careful, may be addictive.
author: Pascal C.

description: crust surprisingly thin and crispy.  wombo combo is great. 25min - fast delivery for friday night
author: Henry C.

description: So I can't really comment on this particular restaurant location, as I mostly just use them for delivery, so my review is just about the pizza.  And Round Table is By Far my favorite pizza as far as chain stores go.  I just love the hell out of it.  It is damned expensive, I must admit, and you don't get pizzas as big as the Wheel of Fortune like you do at so many SF hole-in-the-wall delivery establishments...but those places all suck.  They do; they suck.  I thought I liked Mr. Pizza Man for a while there, and granted they are cheap as hell, and when it is 1:30 in the A.M. they can be a life-saver, but sometimes you are more than just hungry--you want something that Tastes Good.  And Round Table tastes good.  It's the ingredients, man.  So many pizza places, I'm afraid to order sausage or black olives, 'cause often they just taste WEIRD.  Round Table sausage and black olives do not taste weird.  And I love them for that.  Now if only they had better coupons!
author: Brian P.

description: there bbq chicken is really good!  the poeple here are really friendly because for valentines i asked if they could help me arrange the pepperonis in a heart shape to give as a suprise.. but instead they went all out and even cut the pizza dough shape into a heart!
author: christy w.

description: Sadly, we ignored the other reviews and ordered from this location.  It's hard to believe that a pizza place could be so inept, but they actually are.  Save yourself the frustration we and others have experienced and bypass this place for one of the many other SF pizza restaurants that can handle the basics of on-time pizza delivery.   This franchise gives the Round Table brand a bad name; it is a shame the owners don't respond to the multiple poor reviews and bring in capable management.
author: John W.

description: Oh how i love your pizzas! But a star off because your pizza delivery is terrible! I mean 1hr for 2 medium pizzas? I was starving by then ..
author: amandaaa s.

description:
ok. my parent's cleaners was on the same block as round table back then, and i grew up eating pizzas here and remember great things. nowadays i visit the area once in a while and the service has changed a lot!! i went there the other week and the workers acted busy. standing around staring at a customer tahts trying to order, isnt good service. i had to wait a couple minutes before they could even take my order. regardless of service i tried to be nice because of such great memories had here, but its not the same as it used to be. 
when i picked up my order, i ordered a liter of coke to take home(i was in a hurry that night) i paid for it, they never brought the soda out!!!!! me being in a rush totally forgot to ask for it, but still.... when a customer buys a drink, you should bring it out right away. 
i wonder if jeff is still the owner. he was very nice, and always hooked it up. he knew how to handle customers. very professional and kind hearted.
author: sam k.

description: not remmend any one buying $10 pizza. hard, no any filling in dry pizza. i usually buy pizza there in regular pizza. not bad . however there are promot this cheapest in their anniversity . but it was terrible. you would better buy in frozen pizza in store.....
author: kthy k.
